website_summaries.verdict: The $60 SpareOne Emergency Phone for AT&T has tremendous battery life and useful  tracking features, making it a worthwhile addition to your emergency supply kit.
pros: Supports online alerts and location tracking
Loud speaker volume with voice interaction
Glow-in-the-dark buttons, panic siren, and LED flashlight
cons: Requires annual plan to use alert and location services

customer_reviews.title: Phone works great! I got the phone for about $10
customer_reviews.text: Phone works great! I got the phone for about $10. I ended up sticking in a pre-paid ATT Gophone sim card into the phone, and it works just like a regular phone. Ultimatly, I will install an H2o sim card and pay 9$ for 3 months of service. I think the company is going out of business or already shut down...
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Remmert

customer_reviews.title: Horrible phone
customer_reviews.text: Does not last more than a few days with brand new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: wildestar

customer_reviews.title: Check if service available
customer_reviews.text: Can't get signal. Not sure can get prepay or any service as plan is canceled! I love idea of AA batteries in case of power out.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta P.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to get illy set up. Spare One has ...
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to get it set up. Spare One has awful customer service. We have called no less than a dozen times for set up help and nothing yet. The default setting for the emergency button is 911 and the system won't let me change it to my own emergency contacts although it is supposed to allow that.
customer_reviews.author: R. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Good potential life saving device.
customer_reviews.text: Good build quality, glows in the dark, has a flashlight and runs off of AA batteries. I take it with me when I go camping or hiking and even on vacations, you never know when your phone might die and you'll be stranded without any help. This may save my life one day. Though I hope I'll never have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: TheCritic

customer_reviews.title: how easily that can carelessly go off
customer_reviews.text: Haven't programmed yet. Heard it was difficult. Will give 2 away as gifts. Not sure about the red emergency button , how easily that can carelessly go off, causing panic in in someone, like me.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: ATT.COM:  WE DON'T SUPPORT YOUR DEVICE ANYMORE
customer_reviews.text: This sounded like a great backup emergency phone. I especially liked that it used AA batteries that could easily be replaced. Yesterday, I finally attempted to activate this phone, but I got a message on att.com that said, "We don't support your device anymore. Let's find you a new, compatible device that fits your needs." Unfortunately, I waited too long to find this out, and it is too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Grace

customer_reviews.title: No need to activate if using for 911 only.
customer_reviews.text: Does the trick. No need to activate this phone of using for purposes of 911 use only. I dialed 911 out of the box, they answered and I let them know I was just testing for emergency purposes. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Airica Marie

customer_reviews.title: I don't appreciate being sold a phone for which our ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't appreciate being sold a phone for which our local Miami AT&T stores will not sell a $25 GoPhone Refill Card, which is required to activate the phone. The local AT&T managers also informed me that as of October 15, 2017, AT&T will no longer support the SpareOne Emergency phone. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Reuben C

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: AT&T said the phones were obsolete and no longer are able to be activated.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Can’t buy minutes
customer_reviews.text: Great phone but you can’t buy minutes for it anymore so it’s completely worthless
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Not supported
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking that AT&T would support the phone. AT&T does not offer the airtime associated with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Roehr

customer_reviews.title: No longer supported by AT&T. A useless phone.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these phones. AT&T no longer supports it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Dread

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money even at the low price I kpaid
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. Batteries wear down very quickly. A waste of money even at the low price I kpaid.
customer_reviews.author: Cincy Girl

customer_reviews.title: AT&T... Really!?
customer_reviews.text: AT&T Tech support say: "Activation pass code can only be sent via text message", this phone can't get text messages so they refused to activate the phone
customer_reviews.author: Magnus

customer_reviews.title: Despite the other person's comments, text message is NOT ...
customer_reviews.text: Despite the other person's comments, text message is NOT REQUIRED to activate this phone. The users manual at [...]explains the activation process clearly: "Activation Card: Use the unique activation code found on this card to register for the SpareOne Locate & Alert service. Further information can be found on the card or visit www.myspareone.com " See? No text messaging required. Activation is accomplished by following the directions on the Activation Card that is ioncluded in the box with the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Wi-Fi enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating and needlessly complicated to register.
customer_reviews.text: Took it to local ATT store and they activated it for me with a $25 card. However, when I went to the Spareone website to register it I keep getting "registration failed" message even though I have checked all four pages and all the information was filled in correctly. Spare one customers should be spared this big waste of time!
customer_reviews.author: consumeradvocate8

customer_reviews.title: Keep me connected while camping out!
customer_reviews.text: Im not sure why the negative reviews here but I have had mine for a few months now and I love it. Yes activation was time consuming but so worth the security and peace of mind of having the back up phone. My family took this on our annual camping trip and it was good to have since there is not much signal deep in the woods. I have bought 2 more for other family members and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Customer Service and ultimately unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone directly from AT&T who gave incorrect information about it's capabilities. Spent a month attempting to get set up assistance from SpareOne's direct customer support. Finally figured it out on my own only to discover that it eats through a set of batteries each week (even when turning it off after each use). It is also very easy to inadvertently erase the phone numbers you've entered. This was intended to be used by my son on the weekends to let me know when he arrived at the park / friends house. More often than not the numbers I programmed in for him were gone or the phone died. We ended up activating an old smart phone for him.
customer_reviews.author: bookhound

customer_reviews.title: Key features do not work
customer_reviews.text: Activation on AT&T side is needlessly complicated, but doable. Now I am able to make and receive calls on this phone. However, the key feature is having a location service and ability to configure this phone via myspareone.com website. This failed completely. I am was able to create account using the provided activation code, however location service never worked, I've tried multiple times over the past couple of days while my phone was turned on. Configuring speed dial via website does not work either. What is worse is that I called spare one customer support line multiple times over the past 2 days and I am always getting a busy signal.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: SpareOne out of business. ATT cancelling service.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone for a year and was happy with the service and its functionality. Especially the use of double A lithium batteries. Received the letter today from AT&T notifying me that the service will be discontinued October 15th 2017. Very disappointed customer.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Turner

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible. The batteries only last about 10 days even if no calls are made.
customer_reviews.author: peacock

product_meta.title: AT&T SpareOne Emergency Phone - Carrier Packaging (AT&T)
product_meta.description:
Stay connected in almost any situation with the AT&T SpareOne Emergency Phone. 

With the SpareOne Locate & Alert service* you can alert up to five “guardians”. These are people you want to notify in case of an emergency. They’ll receive a email and/or text message with your location if you make a call using the Alert button on the SpareOne phone. 

The MySpareOne online portal allows you to locate the SpareOne Emergency Phone, manage the Guardian contacts, program up to 9 speed dial numbers and setup a low battery alert as well. Phone must be powered on and in service area for Locate & Alert features to work. 

Not only for emergencies. When you want to be free from the distractions of your connected digital life, leave the smartphone behind and take your SpareOne. You’ll have the security of a phone while remaining connected to what matters in the moment. 

POWERED BY AA BATTERIES

The world's most common battery. The SpareOne Emergency phone runs on two AA batteries and never needs charging, simply replace the batteries when necessary. 

SETUP GUARDIANS*

People you want to receive alert messages in the form of text and/or e-mail. 

LOCATE YOUR PHONE*

Locate the phone (if it is turned on) by logging in to your MySpareOne account. 

*requires activation of $25 AT&T Annual Plan

$25 GoPhone Refill Card (sold separately) is required to activate the $25 Annual Plan. Please note: Credit card refill not currently available.
feature_bullets: The SpareOne Emergency Phone is the perfect companion for life’s adventures and unexpected situations
Never charge it – runs on two AA batteries
Large Alert Button to call for help
Emergency Features: Glow in the dark keypad, flashlight, panic siren and SOS signal
Calling on the AT&T nationwide network

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.4 out of 5 stars34 ratings2.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Z432, battery, wall charger, USB cable, phone and feature guide, pre-installed GoPhone SIM card, GoPhone Quick Start Guide, User Guide, GoPhone Plan Terms & Terms of Service.
